subject: Investing
title: Ex-Dividend Dates and Payment Cycle
description: A quick, practical guide to Ex-Dividend Dates and Payment Cycle.

hook.text: An investor bought a stock one day too late and missed a $500 dividend payment. Timing matters.

buildup.text: The ex-dividend date is the cutoff. You must own shares before this date to receive the upcoming payment.

discovery.text: The cycle: declaration date, ex-date, record date, payment date. Each serves a distinct purpose.

twist.text: On the ex-date, the stock price typically drops by roughly the dividend amountâ€”so you can't game it easily.

climax.text: Long-term holders don't worry about ex-dates. They collect every payment automatically over years.

punchline.text: Know the dates, but don't trade around them. Consistency beats timing.

quiz.question: What happens on the ex-dividend date?
options: New buyers no longer qualify for the upcoming dividend
